newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek shares end down, no hints of rally.
newsitem.headline: Greek shares end down, no hints of rally.

text.p: Greek equities fell 0.42 percent, with the market suffering from a lack of funds and no hints of a rally ahead of next month's 1997 budget, brokers said.
"Clearly the market is suffering from a lack of funds. We don't see any funds coming into the market," Nick Stathopoulos of N.Devletoglou Securities said.
The market was waiting to see how National Economy and Finance Minister Yannos Papandoniou faced the 1997 draft budget, due by the end of November.
He has a number of tough choices. Several brokers noted the tide was now running against the economy with the lower dollar and higher oil prices putting pressure on inflation.
Brokers said money coming in to Greece appeared to be going to the money markets and shunning equities and few could offer reasons to expect a rally over the next six weeks.
The Athens general share index closed down 0.42 percent, or 4.00 points at 937.70 from Tuesday's 941.70 close after opening at 940.05 points.
Turnover was at 6.47 billion drachmas on volume of 4.11 million shares boosted by a block trade of 36,470 shares in OTE and 50,000 shares in Papastratos.

Gainers traced decliners 91 to 104 with 31 issues unchanged on 226 traded. Banks fell 0.36 percent, industrials down 0.90 percent and construction ended lower 0.30 percent. Small-caps fell 0.06 percent.
The Merrill Lynch call spread warrant on OTE with a strike price of 3,800 drachmas was quoted at 539-557 at the close. Shares of OTE telecom, the underlying, was unchanged at 4,055 drachmas.
The Merrill Lynch stock index call warrant based on a basket of 23 shares was at 178.60-188.00 drachmas. It expires on January 9 1998 with a strike price of 1000. It was in the money at 1025.9.
The recently launched ING Baring Financial Products American style call warrant based on a basket of six banking stocks was quoted at $10.77-$11.77. The strike price was at $99.6.
The Morgan Stanley Hellenic Blue Chip Warrant, which has a strike price of 100 marks, was quoted at 4,159-4,427 drachmas at the close. --Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
